thread.title: Trafalgar Square vigil held to remember London terror attack victims
thread.title_full: Trafalgar Square vigil held to remember London terror attack victims

author: tmeyjes
title: Trafalgar Square vigil held to remember London terror attack victims
text:
Crowds gather at a vigil for the victims of Wednesday’s attack (Picture: AP Photo/Matt Dunham) Thousands of people have begun to gather in Trafalgar Square to remember the victims of the London terror attack. 
The vigil, which was scheduled to start at 6pm, was organised by London mayor Sadiq Khan in the wake of the attack at the nearby House of Parliament which left four dead and 40 injured.
London terror attacker 'was English teacher obsessed with body building' Amongst those remembered will be PC Keith Palmer, mother Aysha Frade and American tourist Kurt Cochran.
Of the 29 people taken to hospital, seven are said to be in a critical condition.
Also killed in the attack was the terrorist, who has been identified as muslim convert Khalid Masood .
The vigil has been held to remember the victims of the attack (AP Photo/Matt Dunham) MORE: London terror attacker ‘was English teacher obsessed with body building’ 
MORE: Fundraiser set up to help families of the victims of the London terror attack
